page.title: 12SOCIAL CONCERNS IN HOUSTON
page.content: The rapid expansion of population has meant that the services have failed to satisfy the demand. The shortage of school capacity has meant that Houston children may be bussed to nearby Linwood for primary and secondary education. This has brought about a storm of protest from residents in newer outlying areas of the village. The shopping services in the village are inadequate and although the planning authority have recognized the needs, there is difficulty in agreeing on a suitable site because of the effect on nearby residential areas. The rural and conservation flavour of the area is being altered by pressure of population, e.g.litter,river pollution and vandalism of woodland areas.
